Head: Unequally dilated pupils; giddiness; twitching of facial muscles
Constant vertigo; intense sleepiness
Stupefaction; indifference
Hydrocephalus
Stomach: Constant nausea, vomiting; burning pain in epigastrium
Extremities: Numbness, pain and difficulty in moving hands

name: Cystisus laburnum
details: All parts of this shrub are poisonous, producing inflammation of stomach and intestines, with vomiting, diarrhoea, headache, paleness of face and cold skin. Widespread anaesthesia, and convulsions are some of the chief effects of this drug. Cerebrospinal meningitis. Great prostration, sense of constriction in throat, stiffness of nape, tearing from nape into occiput, lusterless eyes.
